QotD: Your fantasy restaurant

  • Jul 27, 2006 at 2:02 PM
  • No comments
If you could open any sort of restaurant, what would it be like?
My restaurant would be a small, family run style of restaurant not unlike Blighty's Bistro in Oak Bay (may faovourite restaurtant in all of Victoria, by far).  The wait staff will have been with the place since opening, and we'd know all the regulars.  It would be intimate but still family friendly and serve a modest number of entrees that cover a broad spectrum of tastes.  Seafood, pasta, pork and beef.  Mmmm.  Gotta get back to Blighty's soon!!

Tags:

  • qotd,
  • fantasy restaurant,
  • blighty's bistro,
  • restaurtant

QotD: I wish I could...

  • Jul 26, 2006 at 10:48 AM
  • No comments

Play any instrument or speak any language, which do you choose?
Question submitted by cruftbox.vox.com.

I'd go the any language gig.  I'd much rather be able to talk to anyone I meet around the world in their native tongue than be able to busk with any available instrument on street corners around the world :)

Tags:

  • qotd,
  • languages,
  • instruments,
  • talent wish

QotD: Sugar, Sugar

  • Jul 25, 2006 at 2:33 PM
  • No comments
What was your favorite candy when you were a kid? How does that compare to now?
I can't recall a particular favourite as a kid.  Candy was candy and it was all good.  I recall Fun Dip, Bottlecaps, Mike'n'Ikes, Goodies, Pixie Stix, Licorice Pipes, Soap Candies (Floral Gums?) with equal fondness.  These days I'm mostly into sour type candies, or fruit gummy/berry type ones.  Can't go wrong with chocolate covered almonds though...

Tags:

  • qotd,
  • candy,
  • favorite candy

QotD: Back where I'm from...

  • Jul 24, 2006 at 8:39 PM
  • No comments

Soda? Cola? Pop? What do you say? Any other regional words that set you apart?
Question submitted by Gladys.

It's pop here, as far as I know.  Coke is Coke, Pepsi is Pepsi, and both are pop of the cola variety.  I don't think there is much regional here that sets us apart, but perhaps I just don't travel enough.

Tags:

  • qotd,
  • pop,
  • regional differences

QotD: Weekend Wrap-up

  • Jul 24, 2006 at 9:44 AM
  • No comments
What was the highlight of this past weekend?
The entire weekend was great, but the highlight had to be going out for dinner with Leanne Friday night.  We don't get out just the two of us very often anymore. so it's that much sweeter when we do.  Other highlights include having watching Naomi and Elijah running about in the sun and being stunned by how beautiful they are, and dinner with friends Sunday night.  We also had the company picnic on Saturday... a busy by fun weekend overall!

Tags:

  • qotd,
  • weekend,
  • weekend wrap-up

QotD: It's hot in here...

  • Jul 22, 2006 at 5:37 PM
  • 1 comment
What's the most extreme weather you've been in? A memorable storm? Heat wave? Or something else?
Dude.  I live in Victoria, with the Pacific Ocean on three sides and in the shadow of the Olympic Pennisula.  Yesterday it reached 34C here, and that's probably as extreme as it's ever been.  Moderation is one of the wonderful things about Victoria, weather-wise.

Tags:

  • qotd,
  • weather,
  • extreme weather

QotD: Shaken not stirred

  • Jul 22, 2006 at 8:34 AM
  • No comments

What's your favorite drink or cocktail? What's in it?
Question submitted by charm.vox.com

Whiskey sour is one of my favorite drinks, but I also like gin martinis, beer, and wine.
